p: Elevated CO 2 is the major anthropogenic greenhouse gas, and rising CO 2 concentrations will influence growth and yield of crop plants via both its direct effects as substrate for photosynthesis and its indirect climatic effects. While future CO 2 trends will probably increase global yields by ~1.8% per decade, warming trends are likely to reduce global yields by ~1.5% per decade ( Lobell and Gourdji, 2012).
